meanings.definition: Rid (someone) of an unwanted feeling, memory, or condition.
meanings.sent1: She purged her mind of negative thoughts before the exam.
meanings.sent2: The therapist helped him purge his fear of spiders.
meanings.sent3: After a good night's sleep, she purged her worries and felt refreshed.
meanings.sent4: The meditation session purged all anxiety from his mind like a gentle breeze.
meanings.sent5: With each deep breath, she purged the stress from her body, feeling lighter.

meanings.definition: Rid (someone) of an unwanted person or thing.
meanings.sent1: The security team purged the intruder from the building swiftly.
meanings.sent2: He decided to purge toxic relationships from his life for his own well-being.
meanings.sent3: The cat purged the unwanted mouse from the house, much to the relief of the owners.
meanings.sent4: The leader purged disloyal members from the group to maintain unity.
meanings.sent5: The detective purged the false leads from the investigation, focusing on the truth.

meanings.definition: Rid (someone) of impure or undesirable elements.
meanings.sent1: The water filtration system purged the impurities from the drinking water.
meanings.sent2: She used a special cleanser to purge the dirt from her pores.
meanings.sent3: The spring cleaning purged the clutter from the house, making it feel spacious.
meanings.sent4: The ritual of burning sage purged negative energy from the room.
meanings.sent5: The intense workout purged toxins from his body, leaving him feeling rejuvenated.
